From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

French

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ni.ke/
  • Audio (France (Toulouse)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Lyon)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Vosges)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Somain)):(file)

Etymology 1

[edit]

From faire la nique, nique +‎ -er (verb suffix).

Verb

[edit]

niquer (intransitive)

  1. (obsolete, dice games) to obtain what was announced on the first throw

Etymology 2

[edit]

Borrowed from Algerian Arabic نيك (nīk), imperfect stem of ناك (nāk), from Arabic ناكَ (nāka). This is the accepted etymology; a theoretically possible derivation from unrelated Dutch neuken is unlikely both on phonetic grounds and because the vulgar use of this word was originally restricted to the more northern dialects of Dutch.

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • n*quer (censored)

Verb

[edit]

niquer

  1. (slang, vulgar) to fuck, shag, screw
    J'ai envie de la niquer. ― I want to fuck her.
  2. (slang) to deceive
    Il m'a bien niqué, avec ses belles promesses. ― He really had me with all his promises.
  3. (slang) to break, destroy
    Il a niqué mon smartphone. ― He fucked up my smartphone.
  4. (slang) to steal
  5. (slang) to beat, hit

1 The French gerund is usable only with the preposition en.
2 In less formal writing or speech, these tenses may be found to have been replaced in the following way:
past historic → present perfect
past anterior → pluperfect
imperfect subjunctive → present subjunctive
pluperfect subjunctive → past subjunctive

(Christopher Kendris [1995], Master the Basics: French, pp. 77, 78, 79, 81).

Synonyms
[edit]

(to fuck, shag, screw):

  • baiser
  • défoncer
  • doeser
  • faire l'amour
  • forniquer
  • fourrer
  • foutre
  • limer
  • mettre
  • piner
  • poutrer
  • prendre
  • sauter
  • tringler
  • troncher

(to deceive):

  • avoir
  • baiser
  • duper
  • enculer
  • entourlouper
  • entuber
  • rouler

(to steal):

  • arrêter
  • attraper
  • carotter
  • chaparder
  • choper
  • chourraver
  • chourrer
  • dérober
  • faucher
  • piquer
  • prendre
  • subtiliser
  • taxer
  • tirer

(to break):

  • abîmer
  • casser
  • détruire
  • esquinter
  • foutre en l'air
  • péter

(to beat, hit):

  • casser la gueule
  • filer une râclée
  • filer une rouste
  • flanquer une râclée
  • flanquer une rouste
Derived terms
[edit]
  • aller se faire niquer
  • ken
  • niqué
  • nique sa mère
  • niquer le burnous (North Africa)
  • niquer sa mère
  • niquer sa race (France)
  • niqueur
